div.p: Greetings. I wrote recently, as much as was necessary, most excellent and illustrious man. Now it seemed to me to write this one thing to you: That Milusian minister, whom the Lutherans placed there, has suddenly died of apoplexy, which I indeed write so that, if it is possible, you may ensure that such a one is not appointed, since previously, as I hear, they used to receive ministers from you. I wanted you to know this immediately.
I ask that you destroy this letter and others, so that they cannot be used against me.
Yours sincerely, Celio Secondo signed. To the most illustrious man, Lord Heinrich Bullinger, most respected lord and brother.
